column1: Benign positional vertigo is the most common type of vertigo.
Benign positional vertigo is also called benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV).
But, your risk for developing BPPV may increase if you have: - Family members with BPPV - Had a prior head injury (even a slight bump to the head) - Had an inner ear infection called labyrinthitis
- As you do this, your provider will look for abnormal eye movements and ask if you feel like you are spinning.
